comments: He is a nice guy, but he treats his class like its high school and calls people out publicly for things. The speeches you have to give are very straightforward and easy but he will give you your feedback IN FRONT of everyone. During a quiz, he even called a student out for taking longer than everyone else! Rude. Easy class though.

comments: Ted was an amazing professor. He likes participation which is something that is a given for a speech class. One of the most memorable Prof\'s I\'ve ver had. He loves to help and lets you know what he\'s looking for when its time for presentations. I recommend him for any of the speech classes you might need.

comments: Levatter is great. He might seem like a boring older gentleman at first but he teaches in a very balanced way consisting of theory and practically. Follow the format he gives and practice. Talk to him, he loves participation and will try his best to help you. Only drawback might be he can be challenging for first time speakers.

comments: His class is very easy and you\'ll know exactly what he wants from the beginning. Its just 3 speeches and 4 quizzes, there is no final. The class is very easy just don\'t miss to much and you\'ll pass. He is very funny and in general its just a very fun class.

comments: I really enjoyed speech 101 with this professor, but I really didn\'t like his grading method. He\'s funny and outgoing, and his lectures aren\'t boring. He does tell you what he expects in an outline of a speech, and his test aren\'t too hard. This class is a medium level. As long as you don\'t miss a speech, an outline, and a test you will pass.

comments: This man has the patience of a saint. My class had a lot of painfully dumb kids in it and he would calmly repeat himself without getting annoyed. He doesn\'t give out easy A\'s but he gives people multiple chances if they\'re trying. My only complaint is sometimes I felt that he didn\'t give sufficient feedback on my speeches.

comments: Although his quizzes are easy. He is a really bad grader. He almost gives everyone the same comments in the classroom "great work" "good speech". But do not feel happy until you get the results back. And you will see what he means by saying "good". If you have good grades do not take his class, he will mess it up.

comments: Prof. Levatter is an amazing speech professor. He gives you such helpful advice and is always so encouraging with students. I learned so much about giving speeches in his class. If you dread public speaking, he definitely will not make you uncomfortable during the process. Attendance is mandatory in his class. He gives easy quizzes as well.

comments: This is probably one of the better options for speech at GCC. Mind, I took a summer course, so I might not be entirely accurate in terms of the normal session, but please note, he\'s rarely there, if ever, for office hours, but devotes a good amount of class time for feedback. Also, participation is graded on a sort of curve, so participate!

comments: He is a nice guy who is always there for you. During 5 weeks class you will have 3 speeches and 4 multiple choice quizzes. It was a fun class; I definitely recommend his class. The book is affordable. When I read the earlier comments, and now that I know him in person I think he changed himself, because he never judged us based on our opinion.

comments: He was really great and helped you a lot. He always gave tips of how to improve and if he saw you made improvements, he would give you a better grade. I recommend anyone to take him. The only problem with him is that he is never in his office hours. But honestly, you never need to go there, he stays after class for a bit if you want to talk to him.

comments: Professor Levatter is really easygoing and is willing to help you out whenever you need help. After your speech he will tell you what you did well on and critique it as well so you can improve later on. He sets clear guidelines in how to do well in his class. Follow them and you\'ll be in good shape.

comments: Excellent teacher. Very clear about what he wants and always gives feedback as to how you can improve. He\'s very good about helping students feel comfortable talking in front of the class. This was my most dreaded class but I ended up getting an A. Only 3 speeches, whereas the other professors assign 5-6. Follow his directions, ull be fine.
